message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.SD 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with sequence prediction problems, such as phonemes in speech and named entities in sentences. Additionally, the paper discusses end-to-end training for segmental models, which is a popular approach in natural language processing. 

The paper also involves the use of neural networks, which suggests that it could belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). 

Furthermore, the paper mentions the use of segmental models for action recognition in videos, which could place it in the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CV (Computer Vision). 

The paper's focus on improving efficiency in decoding suggests that it could belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), as efficiency is an important consideration in many AI applications. 

Finally, the paper's discussion of graph search-based models, such as hidden Markov models, could place it in the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.SD (Systems and Control).
